data.pageText: An administrative agency is an official governmental body empowered with the authority to direct and supervise the implementation of particular legislative acts. Simply put, an agency is a governmental body that does part of the government’s work. In addition to the word “agency,” such governmental bodies may be called commissions, corporations, boards, departments, or divisions.
Here are some examples of federal administrative agencies.
Select each tab to <add specifics on what the students will learn/review>.

The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is part of the United States Department of Justice. The FBI has the full authority and responsibility to investigate crimes and defend the U.S. from security threats. For more information on the FBI, please visit this link: FBI website. The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) is part of the United States Department of Labor and their mission is to assure safe and healthful working conditions by setting and enforcing standards and providing training, outreach, education, and assistance. For more information on OSHA, please visit this link: OSHA website.
